description: This table contains data on actions that a user took on a direct message. For example, information about linking messages to patients, routing and creating referrals are all discretely audited in this table.

columns.name: DOCUMENT_ID
columns.description: This item stores the Received Document record ID.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: MSG_ACT_C_NAME
columns.description:
Contains granular actions that were performed on a Provide and Register message (or incoming group of external documents). Such actions may include how the patient was linked to the message, routing, and referral creation that occurred. These actions are shown to the user on an audit trail on the Incoming Messages Report or the International Review Report.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Received


Pended


Manually linked to patient


Automatically linked to matching patient


Created patient


Automatically routed to In Basket


Manually routed to In Basket


Manually created a referral


Automatically created a referral


Rejected


Processed


Routing to In Basket


Released Documents


No patient match


No routing needed


No referral needed


In Basket routing failure


Reply sent


Reply received


External encounter linked to originating referral


Automatically created patient


Automatically linked due to known referral


Conversation reviewed


Encounter invalidated


Linked patient does not match source referral patient


Message comment added


Message received to place external order


Message received to update external order


Message received to cancel external order


External order message timed out


External order message resubmitted


Resolved associated external chart correction notice


Routing decision reset


Referral decision reset


Source Patient Id discarded


Automatically linked due to matching external patient ID

columns.name: MSG_ACT_CMT
columns.description: Contains comments for actions that were performed on a Provide and Register message (or incoming group of external documents). Such actions may include how the patient was linked to the message, routing, and referral creation that occurred. These actions are shown to the user on an audit trail on the Incoming Messages Report or the International Review Report. Comments can be user entered or hard coded.

columns.name: MSG_ACT_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: Contains the time of actions that were performed on a Provide and Register message (or incoming group of external documents). Such actions may include how the patient was linked to the message, routing, and referral creation that occurred. These actions are shown to the user on an audit trail on the Incoming Messages Report or the International Review Report.

columns.name: MSG_ACT_EXTERNAL_ORDER_UID
columns.description: This item contains the identifier of an external order associated with an event such as receiving an interface message to place an order, to update an order, or to cancel an order.
